ApplicationFees: The application fee for domestic and international undergraduate applicants is $50. The application fee for domestic and international graduate applicants is $100.
TestPolicy: Undergraduate: Stony Brook University has adopted a test-optional admissions policy for first year students.
CoursesAndGrades: ### Recommended High School Curriculum for Admission
AdditionalInformation: For certain programs and applicant types, Stony Brook University requires additional information beyond the standard application.
AdditionalDeadlines: ### Key Dates for Financial Aid and Scholarships at Stony Brook University
TuitionFees: Undergraduate (Full-Time): ~$7,070 per year (Resident), ~$31,046 per year (Non-Resident/Supplemental Tuition).
IsGreRequired: null. The official Stony Brook University website states, "The GRE General Test is required by several Graduate School programs. Please refer to the admissions requirement information about your specific program of interest". This indicates that GRE requirements are determined by individual programs and are not universally required for all programs for international students. For example, for the Spring 2026 and Fall 2026 admission cycles, the GRE is not required for any PhD applicants in Computer Science, but it is required for international MS applicants to that program who do not have a post-secondary degree from the United States or Canada. Conversely, the GRE is waived for the Spring & Fall 2025 admission cycle for the Materials Science and Chemical Engineering department. Because the requirement is not explicitly stated as a uniform mandate for all programs, a definitive 'True' or 'False' answer for the entire university cannot be provided.
GradInternationalStudents: ## International Graduate Student Enrollment at Stony Brook University
UGScholarshipHigh: The highest undergraduate scholarship for Stony Brook University for which a specific value is explicitly stated on the university's website is the #YouAreWelcomeHere Scholarship, which covers 50% of tuition.
